Class WumpusHunt

java.lang.Object
  WumpusHunt

public class WumpusHunt
extends Object

This class will implement the Hunt the Wumpus game. Another version of the game can be played here: http://www.dreamcodex.com/playwumpus.php

Nested Class Summary

Constructor Detail

WumpusHunt

public WumpusHunt(int width,
                  int height)
This is the constructor to create a new game board and display. width * height is the max number of cave vertexes that can be created in the landscape

Parameters:
width - - width of the cave system
height - - height of the cave system
Method Detail

setConnectionProb

public static void setConnectionProb(double prob)
This method will set the CONNECTIO_PROB static double

Parameters:
prob - - new connection Probability for the cave system

getConnectionProb

public static double getConnectionProb()
This method will return the CONNECTION_PROB static variable, the connection probability for the dynamic cave

Returns:
connection probability for the dynamic cave

setupUI

private void setupUI()
This method sets up the listeners for the keyboard controls in the game

drawWumpus

private void drawWumpus()
This method will change the game settings so that the wumpus is drawn. It kills the wumpus however

reset

public void reset()
This method resets the game to the initial settings.

createGrid

private void createGrid()
This method will create a static grid of unconnected vertexes on the landscape. A Vertex will be placed at all integer spots in the landscape.

createDynamicCave

public void createDynamicCave()
This makes the a dynamic Cave that will be different each time. This method will only create a cave where connections between the Verticies are north/south and east/west. The connections will also be between neighboring Verticies on the landscape

createConnections

public void createConnections()
This method creates more complex connections within the cave system. It will pick a random number of the vertexes in the list of Vertices based on the CONNECTION_PROB data field. if a chosen vertex has either 2 or 4 edges, it will turn this from a cave opening to a path between different openings. It will connect its neighbors based in one of 4 types of arrangements. The cave will remain connected but paths will connect different openings.

Type 1: North and East neighbors are now connected. As well as West and South neighbors

Type 2: North and West neighbors are now connected. As well as East and South neighbors

Type 3: North and South neighbors connected only

Type 4: East and West neighbors connected only

createCompleteCave

private void createCompleteCave()
This method can be used to create complete cave where every integer point in the landscape will contain a cave opening with a path to the neighboring cave in all 4 directions: north, south, east, west. All connections will be straight (north/south ; east/west)

This method is unused in the current implementation

makeNeighbor

public void makeNeighbor(Vertex v)
This method will make a random connection between the Vertex v and one of its neighbors. The connection will be in the straight direction (north/south ; east/west).

Parameters:
v - - Vertex with which to create a new neighbor for

createStaticCave

public void createStaticCave()
This method will create a static cave that is on a 4x4 grid. it will create the connections between all the edges and place them on the landscape and everything.

This method is not in use in the current implementation, but can be used by changing the initialization code.

fire

public void fire(Vertex.Direction dir)
This method will have the hunter fire an arrow in the given direction dir. This method handles all of the information dealing with if it hits the wumpus or misses. It will still fire the arrow even if its is fired in a direction that does not have a path to another cave.

Parameters:
dir - - direction upon which to fire the arrow

setInvisible

public void setInvisible()
This will make the cave system not visible on the display. It will set the marked boolean on all of the verticies to false

setVisible

public void setVisible()
This will make the cave system visible on the display. It will set the marked boolean of all the verticies to true.

initializeGame

public void initializeGame()
This method will initialize the game of Hunt the Wumpus. It assumes a cave system has already been initialized. It will place the Wumpus and the hunter randomly in the cave, as well as compute which cave openings are within 2 cave openings of the Wumpus. It will make sure to not place the hunter in the same room as the wumpus.

checkAgents

public void checkAgents()
This method is a checker method to make sure that the Wumpus is agent 0 and the Hunter is agent 1. It will print out to the screen whether this is true or not

rePaint

public void rePaint()
This method will repaint the display

advance

public void advance()
This method handles the iteration of the game. If the game is not paused it will update the State of all of the elements in the landcape (calls landscape advance). If the wumpus is dead it will display all of the parts of the cave.

printUsage

public static void printUsage()
This method will print out the usage of the WumpusHunt game to the terminal:

Usage: WumpusHunt [-w,--width] [-h, --height]

main

public static void main(String[] args)
This method will run the Hunt the Wumpus game.

Parameters:
args - - optional inputs of the width(-w) and the height (-h)
